title: Very interesting (archeological) tour
text: We had a archeologist as a guide. For me, it was a bit too much of that in the beginning as we didn't cover that much of Athens on the roughly 2 hours, but it was yet a very good introdution on my first day in Athens, hence a good start for more independent exploring the following days. Group size was ok, I think we were about 8 or 9.

title: Great one to one tour of Athens
text: I had one guide just for myself. Eventhough my match didn't contact me at first, we made it work the last day of my stay. It was a very intersting roughly 2h tour of the center. Maybe even better on the first day of a stay in Athens.
place: This Is Athens with a Local

title: Nice and sometimes very touristy area
text: Located on the hill towards the Acropolis, this area, or at least some streets, are very very touristy and take away a lot of the charm that there still would be from all the small houses.

title: Hipster bar/coffee with a big big garden
text: Serving meals, coffee and drinks. Just the garden is worth a visit, loads of seatings on different levels outside. Can be very crowded.

title: Good and fast vegan meals
text: Very modern restaurant/take out on a unfortunately very loud intersection, close to the Acropolis museum. Food is tasty, I wish it would've been freshly made and not prepared and reheated. Staff is very friendly.

title: Great vegetarian and vegan food
text: This restaurant serves meals all day, loads of also vegan options. Staff is very friendly and helpful and the portions are good sized. Prices are not low and I even had to pay for two tiny pieces of bread.

title: Great vegan Gyros
text: Just a small take out place but with delicious vegan Gyros (there sare several options) and very charming staff. Seating outside is unfortunately very limited.

title: Very friendly, and good take out vegetarian and vegan food
text: Even though all the food is already prepared and is only getting heated, I really enjoyed it, very friendly and helpful staff. It can get very full from one minute to the other.

title: Nice hip coffee in a nice court
text: This is one of several coffee shops surrounding a nice little court/park, super quiet even though just a few steps away from the main roads. Epireia is probably the hippest/most modern of them with a slow but very friendly staff and good coffee.

title: Delicious but rather expensive food
text: Charming restaurant a bit off the main streets. The food was quite delicious, I enjoyed the new approach to traditional greek dishes. Prices are rather high, though.

title: Good food, small portions
text: Apparently Seychelles is a must stop while in Athens. The food was delicous, whilst the portions were really small and hence quite expensive. There's a lot of staff, yet service was quite slow and not personal at all.

title: Very stylish, mediocre service
text: It's a very stylish bar/restaurant and nice to hang out, read or even work at one of the tables on the gallery. I wish service was better, though.

title: Very cute and sort of french coffee
text: They make their own cakes and good coffee and also have a nice outside seating area under some trees. Service was unfortunately very slow even though this place is so small.

title: Very small and super cute corner coffee
text: Quite an island of quiet in an otherwise rather noisy neighbourhood. The shop is small, but there's also seating outside. The coffee was good and staff very nice.

title: Good coffee, slow service
text: Thsi coffee shop is quite big and offers also alcoholic coffee cocktails and food. I enjoyed the coffee (the barista is the center of the shop) and the friendly staff, but service was very very slow and prices quite high.

title: Nice store(s) in Plaka
text: Another rare not so touristy stop in an otherwise not interesting shopping street in Plaka. The store has two parts (on both sides of the corner) and loads of intersting items.

title: Nice and not touristy shop
text: This shop was a nice change in Plaka with all it's uber touristy shops all around. I wish Flaneur hat more Greek brands. But it's nevertheless a good stop.

title: The highlight of Acropolis
text: Of course, the Parthenon is the most famous building at Acropolis. Unfortunately, it's still partially covered by the construction. And no, Parthenon is not accessible. But it's also interesting to see the construction happening and a lot of large pieces lined up for the never ending puzzle.

title: A must see
text: I was there in december, so there weren't many people, very quiet and never any lines. Unfortunately a lot of the area was fenced off, I don't know if that's different during summer tourist season.

title: Interesting museum well located
text: Luckily, this museum is right next to the south entrance of the acopolis. Admission is only 5â‚¬ and there's lot to see and archeologists on site to help more. It's a good addition to the Acorpolis itself as the museum shows the smaller parts and pieces. The terrace has a nice view of the Acropolis.

title: Not a luxury hotel
text: I stayed at this hotel because the Wyndahm Residence next door decided to be closed for repairs. The rooms are quite modern and spacious, but a lot of details weren't right. I had a dirty cloth from housekeeping and half used shampoo bottles instead of new ones in the bathroom and used coffee capsulses from the guests before in the coffee machine whilst somedays the trash didn't get emptied, asf. And there's a roughly 1-2 cm gap under the room door and the connecting door to the next room, I did hear everything happening outside in the hallway as well as in the next room. And the windows are really bad so it's noisy all night from the street and I could hear pedestrians talking even though i was on the 5th floor. With those windows the room also was usually very hot during the day and super cold at night. Breakfast was good with a cool view of the Acropolis, but I wish the tables and chairs were cleaned after people left, I always had to do that myself. Internet was fast and password protected. Staff was usually friendly and helpful but I just didn't feel like having to go down to reception more than daily becuase many things weren't right.

title: Hotel was closed due to repairs, rooms were nevertheless sold
text: I booked this hotel just a few days before my arrival, but wasn't informed until my arrival that this hotel is actually currently closed due to repairs and I would be staying at the other Wyndham next door. The rooms would be same, according to an e-mail I received the same day, it would even be an upgrade. But it became clear right there and when comparing both hotel's websites that I ended up getting a smaller room, without kitchen or sofa. The closed hotel continued to sell its rooms online during my stay

title: Fancy rooms in the Wallis alps
text: I was in one of the newest rooms, they're really fancy, very spacious but could've been cleaner (it seemed like the floor didn't get cleaned in the morning). Breakfast was average, no special options. My room also had a huge terrace but which was shared with the other rooms. So people could look into the rooms and due to the window between the bedroom and the bathroom also there. So if you value some privacy try to get a different room or have the blinds closed at all times.

title: Every time an friendly and good place
text: Whenever I'm in Hamburg I will make at least one stop at Playground, good coffee, lovely staff and a very small but cozy place, and some seating outside.

title: Great coffee
text: For a take away coffee it's probably not such a good location but the coffee was more than good and the staff super friendly and helpful. Not cheap, though.

title: Sleek budget hotel but no AC
text: For a budget hotel near the Reeperbahn it's quite a good choice. Clean and modern but very small rooms. Unfortunately the wifi has no password, that's not very safe. And unfortunately - and that's why it's not more than 3 of 5 points - despite the website and the confirmation upon check in and again after the first night, the rooms do not have an AC, only heating in September because it's supposedly too cold outside. But the room was unbearably hot from the sun, I couldn't open the window due to the street noise and I could only change my room after 3 nights.

title: Amazing value, great room
text: I'm not sure if this hotel is always less than 100 chf per night, but for that, it's a great value. within walking distance from the main station, about 10 minutes, very spacious and clean and modern room (no view though) and a good breakfast. Only the check in was very very slow.

title: Nothing special
text: The stay at this hotel was nothing special at all. We didn't get the two beds we booked and had confirmed, we only had one bath towel even after requesting a second, no shower gel, just nothing. And when we told them that we had to leave before breakfast, again no creative offer. Upon checking out they were only worried that we have paid, no other questions, no charm. Instead letting us wait outside the locked door not telling us that the other person waiting outside actually works there. And there was a very bad smell in the restaurant in the morning, so we were quite happy to skip their breakfast. At least if you come by car, there's loads of space to park.

title: Local neighbourhood restauant
text: With good local food, also vegetarian options and good seating on the street. Friendly staff who I belive doesn't speak English, so even more the non touristy place to go to.

title: Award winning decor, good food
text: Apparently this hipster stylish corner coffee shop won an award for its interior. Pastry was great, coffee not so much.

title: Cool and stylish sit down bar
text: It's more of a lounge with waiter service than a bar. Nice mid century furniture, interesting drinks and friendly (very young) cheeful waiting staff.

title: Great vegetarian/vegan food, nice staff
text: We arrived late and it took the waiter a bit to warm up and be welcoming but we were allowed to stay and have dinner, food was great (interesting dishes) and also the waiter got very nice and charming in the end.

title: surprisingly large and popular neighbourhood bar
text: even on a sunday evening this place was very full, but peaceful. there were boardgames, dogs and friendly staff and a vast drink selection.

title: Very rude staff
text: It shall be said that in the end we didn't go in, as the staff at the door and the cloak room were already so rude that we decided this wouldn't be our place even though we heard great things about the party basement. So maybe it's worth putting up with the initial challenges but that's just not for me.

title: Very cool place, great food and coffee
text: It's not in the centre of Prague at all but was a great place. They have interesting and tasty food, good coffee, also some crazy creations and very very friendly staff. Seating outside is cool for people watching.

title: Cool bar inside the old military builing
text: It looks a lot older and more abandoned from the outside. The bar in the court yard was in the end surpringly fashionable. There was an interesting mix of people, younger surrounding a fire while there was an birthday group adding more to the fancy vibe. Staff was very friendly and it's definitely worth a visit just for the hudge building. There's more to explore there but mostly during the day.

title: Excellent vegan food and great staff
text: We arrived a bit late but they still acoomodated us after checking with the chef. Staff was very friendly and helpful and the food was very delicous. I wasn't a fan of the decor, though.

title: Great breakfast despite the view
text: Venue offers great breakfast and coffee, and a lovely staff. It's unfortunately facing a loud and touristy market just outside, but it was worth the visit anyway.

title: No charm whatsoever
text: The cafÃ© looks nice and modern and it's in a court yard so away from the street. The staff howeve was completely charmless or even rude. Apparently they were already in the morning out of most of the brunch/breakfast options but didn't even bother to tell us in a nice and direct way. But we then left.

title: Not a large selection in store
text: It was a bit of a disappointment, as the online shop suggests a vast selection of czech design but the boutieque store has only very limited items in stock, mostly jewelery. So it might be better using the online store if there's no need to acutally see the things in real.

title: Interesting cultural centre
text: There's one exhibition open all day and a bar with some seating outside facing the rail tracks. It feels nice but it's a bit of a walk from the train station (and it's not directly accessible). It feels artsy and quiet.

title: Great museum for modern art, a bit off the centre
text: The museum focuses on contemporary art (as the name suggests) and was very interesting, there were apparently mostly rotating exhibitions. It's a bit away, but the tram ride even was interesting. The roof is also accessible.

title: It's a must
text: It's just one of the must sights in Prague and it was of course very crowded and full of souvenir stands, but it's doable, even to see some of the statues.

title: Big and modern appartment for a great price
text: This appartment was really big and very modern. A hudge living room/kitchen and a seperate bedroom. And still some of the old building's charm. Everything was provided, loads of towels, coffee and so forth. There were a few minor glitches like that the Wifi was sometimes very slow, there was for a few moments no cold water, no light in the staircase and also while in general it was very clean, some items were apparently never cleaned. Pricewise this was unbeatable, maybe it did help that it's right on the other side of the river and therefore in a cheaper area but it's really just a few minutes more to walk every day and there are plenty of bus and tram stopps nearby.

title: Still great vegetarian food
text: I've been there several times. This time the staff was friendlier than the last time, the food has been once again really good. The selection is still great. It's better to reserve ahead, even without we got a table but only for a limited tine.

title: Great museum for modern art
text: I've been there several times and it's always worth a visit. Entry is free, even the special exhibitions. The entire cultural precinct is a great area with several museums. And the one for modern art is no exception. There's also AC and free Wifi.

title: Always worth a visit
text: This museum is just worth a visit everytime when in Sydney. Most of the gallery is even free and there's a great roof top terrace with a super view. The galleries change, I've been always very happy also with the rotating and special exhibitions.

title: Cool coffee in Marrickville
text: Was my first stop when exploring Marrickville. It's quite a fresh and fancy looking coffeeshop. I had a take away coffee and was treated very friendly by the barrista as a first time costumer. The coffee was okay, but not great.

title: Great food and great coffee beans
text: Located in an old shed/warehouse (as always in Marrickville), they served great lunch and also good drinks. And the beans they roast and sell are among the best I've found in Sydney.

title: Great bar with a great vibe
text: I've been there before and luckily this bar hasn't changed much. It's still a great decor, a trailer outside to smoke and cool coasters. And there were several short shows on stage. There's limited snacks also with cool names.

title: Average coffee, but apparently the place to be
text: The line was very long every morning. So I decided to give it a try. They're very friendly and are dealing very well with the long line dispersing freely around outside. But the coffee itself was nothing special at all.

title: Great take away coffee and beans
text: I bought several coffees there and also some beans. Among the best of both I've bought/had in Sydney. It's usually less crowded than the coffee shops around, which surprises me.

title: Great take away coffee
text: I just stopped briefly for a take away coffee. The coffee was good (not great) but the staff was really friendly and charming. They also have a self service bar for batch brew coffee.

title: Very good coffee and beans
text: I just had a cup to take away and bought some beans. The beans were also very good and the staff very helpful.

title: Excellent wine tour in the Yarra Valley
text: We visited 4 Wineries and 1 chocolatery. We had a great guide, a good day and some interesting tastings with luckily just a small group. Unfortunately all the 4 tastings were before lunch but that apprently is normal.

title: Main square facing Flinders Station
text: Good starting point for the museums there as well as the river and the CBD. The square itself is sometimes just lined with the restaurants but sometimes according to what's happening in Melbourne (eg Australia Open)

title: Central shopping mall
text: located in the CBD. Architecturewise quite interesting, some old factory remains. The usual chains but also some local designers available.

title: A piece of Italy in Melbourne
text: This street just off the CBD is filled with Italian restaurants, but there are other intersting restaurants, bars and coffees now also opening up.

title: safe bed for vegetarian food in melbourne
text: this time we were lucky and didn't have to wait. the food as always is good, the staff helpful and the prices reasonable. so it's almost a must stop for vegetarians in melbourne,

title: Well hidden coffee shop worth the walk
text: I was taken there by a friend, it's impossible to just find it, it's in a court. We just had coffee which was great, but when coming earlier they also do food all day.

title: Excellent breakfast, lovely staff
text: I had a very good breakfast, great coffee and some very charming and friendly waiters/barristas. It apparently can get full but it's worth the wait. They also do takeaway.

title: coffee shop in an old warehouse
text: Small place for coffee in Fritzroy. I wasn't a big fan of the (not friendly) staff or the (watery) coffee but really liked the venue.

title: Great rooftop bar
text: Apparently there can be a line to get up, but we were lucky. The roof top was great, with a good view of Melbourne. The staff a at the bar a bit lacklustre but it was okay.

title: Cool hipster coffee shop
text: I like it that it's a bit hidden away in one of the back lanes. The coffee was nice, the staff friendly and the interior really modern hipish.

title: Fancy serviced apartments in the CBD of Melbourne
text: I had a very good deal on my stay and even got an upgrade to a two bedroom appartment. In general the place is very fancy, but some pieces in the kitchen were dirty or unusable (old knives, stains...) and the laundy machine wouldn't work initially, so it can sometimes be a bit of hassle to get things going. But the place itself is nice, there's even an indoor pool and a gym.

title: Exellent vegetarian friendly restaurant
text: Good and very interesting choice of meals. Also the staff was very friendly and helpful. It's best to go with friends as the idea is to get more than one plate and than share. It's not cheap but worth a visit.

title: Good neighbourhood outside the city centre
text: It used to be trashier and cheaper but there's still a good choice of restaurants, coffee shops and thrift stores, it's just a bit more expensive now than a few years ago.

title: Great coffee
text: A bit tucked away and all outside seating, but a good choice for a coffee (also take away) and a quick breakfast. Service was in my case very swift and friendly. A bit hipsterish and supposedly a chain but yet a nice stop in the West End of Brisbane.

title: good food, good coffee, good staff
text: Small coffee shop with a limited number of tables. Coffee and my breakfast were really good. It's not a cheap place for a bite but it's a good choice and a good reason to explore the West End of Brisbane.

title: Great view for a great price
text: Well, it is an Ibis and therefore a chain but I really enjoyed this room, very fancy with a hudge window facing the city and the river. Room was clean and nice and had everything I needed. Also the staff was mostly very friendly. And there were some nice perks like free laundry. Due to a special price this was an unbeatable offer even during ANZAC day.

title: Very decent hostel with a strange vibe
text: The YHA is a bit off the city where some hostels are located. The building is quite large with a patio and also roof top even with a pool and a great view. The rooms have AC and shared bathrooms which were quite clean. But the vibe was a bit strange to me, people didn't talk to each other at all, in the hallway, the terrasse or anywhere. That might not be the hostels' fault but didn't make me stay for long. Staff was actually very friendly and helpful.

title: Very friendly cafÃ© with a goodlooking menu
text: I just stopped there for a drink, but they also have a good selection of sweet and savoury meals. And there's a nice breeze even though it's just a bit of water view and not right at the water front. Staff is friendly and there's lots of freshly made to order to choose from.

title: Good restaurant and view
text: I had dinner there because I stayed at the hotel. Apparently it's a very famous restaurant not only because of the view. My dinner was quite good but it's a pricy place, when looking at how much food is down in the city of luganville.
place: Deco Stop Lodge Narcosis Bar & Restaurant

title: Great first blue hole
text: It's the one blue hole that apparently all the tours stop, so it might get a bit full, well, in local standards, but it's a nice place to swim and there's also some shade and a restroom.

title: It's a hit or miss place for lunch
text: You choose one building and have your filling and cheap lunch there. This time I didn't get very lucky, While I had plenty of food, it was just about average and not so friendly.

title: Nice hotel overlooking the bay, nice room
text: It's a bit of resort style around a nice pool with good furniture and a nice view. Staff is mostly very friendly and helpful. The room was nice, airy and had AC but was a bit noise becuase the kitchen was right behind my bathroom. The view is good but it's quite a walk to and from the city centre.

title: Good restaurant when staying at the hotel
text: I had dinner twice there because of my stay at the hotel. The food was okay and vegetarian friendly upon request. It can be slow or fast, so bring a bit of island time with you. One evening it was very crowded, a band was playing and I had not very nice table while the other night it was all good.

title: It's the thing to visit when in Tanna
text: It's a tour up the volcano. Depending on your hotel it's a bit of a drive and also a long wait once at the base. But the tour itself was good, of course the acitivty and the weather are a matter of luck.

title: Good resort on the coast
text: Resort style hotel. The room was quite fresh and fairly new with private bathroom but no AC (which is available but costs more). The garden itself is not very usable, there's no beach and at the pool there's no umbrellas or furniture. But the staff is nice and there's (slow but free) Wifi in the reception area. Breakfast is also okay.
